steps.description: Select the user you want to create availability for. By default, this should be your own user.
steps.label: User
steps.title: User

steps.description: From the list, Select the User Calendar that you would like to use to sync events for this User. If you haven't create a Google Calendar yet, please do so from New Google Calendar.
steps.label: Google Calendar
steps.title: Google Calendar

steps.description: In this child table, you will be able to select the time slots you'll be available for each days. Click on Add Row to start adding availability.
steps.label: Appointment Time Slot
steps.title: Setup Time Slots

steps.description: Enter the day you want to set availability for. For example, you can start setting with Monday.
steps.label: Day
steps.title: Time Slot - Day

steps.description: Enter the start time for this day. For example, if you are available only after 11:00 AM on this day, enter 11 and press tab.
steps.label: Start Time
steps.title: Time Slot - Start Time

steps.description: Enter the end time for this day. For example, if you are available only till 7:00 PM on this day, enter 19 and press tab.
steps.label: End Time
steps.title: Time Slot - End Time

steps.description: You can repeat this process for different days you're available on.
steps.label: Appointment Time Slot
steps.title: Setup More Days

steps.description: To setup Personal Meetings, enable this.
steps.label: Enable Personal Meetings
steps.title: Setup Personal Meetings

steps.description:
Set a unique slug for yourself. If the slug you enter is not available, we'll recommend you another slug that you can use, or you can enter something else.

The default value for this will be your username.
steps.label: Slug
steps.title: Personal Meetings - Setup Slug

steps.description:
Select the Meeting Provider that you would like to use to schedule meetings.
You can choose from the following:
  • None: Use this to not schedule a meeting.
  • Custom: Use this to enter a custom meeting link, for example your personal zoom meeting url. If you choose this, enter your custom link in the field Meet Link.
  • Zoom: Use this to schedule a new meeting using Zoom. Only works if zoom is enabled in Scheduler Settings
  • Google Meet: Use this to schedule a new meeting using Google Meet.
steps.label: Meeting Provider
steps.title: Personal Meeting - Meeting Provider

steps.description: After someone schedules a meeting with you, a mail will be sent to them using this email template. You can either create a new email template, or select the default one [Default] Appointment Scheduled. You can also create a copy of this default template, and add your custom branding on this.
steps.label: Response Email Template
steps.title: Personal Meeting - Response Email Template

steps.description: This child table will be used to setup durations, which will allow someone scheduling personal meetings with you for a predefined duration.
steps.label: Available Durations
steps.title: Personal Meeting - Setup Available Durations

steps.description: Just a recommendation: Edit the Duration and Buffer time fields only after opening the row in expanded view, becuase there is a bug (from frappe core) due to which selecting a duration from collapsed view is difficult.
steps.label: Title
steps.title: Recommendation

steps.description: Enter the title for this Duration. For example, you can put something like Quick, or Standard.
steps.label: Title
steps.title: Available Durations - Title

steps.description: Enter the durations this type of meeting should be for. For example, a Quick meeting can be for 15 minutes long, or a Standard meeting can be for 1 hour long.
steps.label: Duration
steps.title: Available Durations - Duration

steps.description: [Optional] You can set a buffer time between meetings using this field. For example, if you set it to 30 minutes, any meeting scheduled for this type will have atleast 30 minutes gap in between.
steps.label: Minimum Buffer Time
steps.title: Available Durations - Minimum Buffer Time

steps.description: [Optional] You can enter number of days here such that the slots will be visible only for these many days after the current date.
steps.label: Availability Window
steps.title: Available Durations - Availability Window

steps.description:
[Optional] By setting this, you can limit the number of events of this type that can be booked in a single day. For example, setting it to 2 will ensure only 2 events of this type will appear on your calendar for a day.
If this limit gets exhausted, no more slots will be visible for that day in your calendar.
steps.label: Limit Booking Frequency
steps.title: Available Durations - Limit Booking Frequency

steps.description: [Optional] You can set number of days here such that the slots will be visible after these number of days from the current date.
steps.label: Minimum Notice Before Event
steps.title: Available Durations - Minimum Notice Before Event

steps.description: If you want, you can setup additional durations aswell, following the same steps. Once done, ensure to save the document.
steps.label: Available Durations
steps.title: Setup more Durations
